title: Unknown: A Single Life in Web4 — Trust Under Pressure
summary: This single-life simulation tests how an agent performs within a single lifetime, without the safety net of karma carry-forward or rebirth. This simulation follows Unknown through 1 life spanning 20 ticks. Starting with trust of 0.60 and ending at 0.60, the agent maintained stable behavior, experiencing 2 major events along the way. Key themes include: Equilibrium and Stability. This narrative illustrates core Web4 principles: trust is earned through consistent behavior, actions have lasting consequences (karma), and agents can learn and improve across multiple lives through epistemic proprioception.
key_insights: Trust remained stable: 0.60 → 0.60 over 1 lives. The agent found equilibrium quickly.

events.description: A new agent enters the Web4 society. Starting with trust of 0.60 and 100 ATP (attention tokens), they must prove themselves through consistent behavior.
events.significance: First impressions matter. Initial trust sets expectations.

events.description: Trust stabilizes at 0.60. The agent has found a sustainable pattern of behavior. This plateau suggests they've reached equilibrium between their capabilities and society's expectations.
events.significance: Part of the ongoing trust dynamics.

events.description: Life ends: natural. Final trust: 0.60, ATP: 100. Duration: 20 ticks.
events.significance: Death isn't failure - it's part of the cycle. What matters is the trust you carried forward.
